result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI Cause Injury (2+) and PAC Cause Injury (2+). The defendant was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+) and the other charge, PAC Cause Injury (2+) was dismissed by the court.

  • Nicholas M Kramer was found guilty of OWI Cause Injury (2+), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(2)(a)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Straight Probation, NOT SEX OFFENDER PROBATION.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine.  Any remaining fine to be paid as a condition of probation.
Cash applied to Restitution.  Paid in full.
Blood draw cost paid in full, to be forwarded to Village of Pewaukee Police Department.  DNA Surchage to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel during probation.

No contact with the victims listed in the criminal complaint.
Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Driver's License.
Defendant is ALLOWED to use computer for work and personal use.  Provide DNA Sample if not yet provided and pay surcharge.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: dated Dec 8, 2015 from Atty Amy Scholz regarding sentence credit
Associated with Charge #1
Character letter filed.

Defendant Nicholas M Kramer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Scholz makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

OWI SENTENCE WITH PROBATION
The Court Orders the Following on Count #1:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of 
36 MONTHS Imprisonment STAYED
18 MONTHS of Initial Confinement STAYED
18 MONTHS of Extended Supervision STAYED

If revoked: Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
If revoked: Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

Term of Probation: 3 Years STRAIGHT PROBATION, NOT SEX OFFENDER PROBATION

Conditions of Probation:
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.s;
No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia;
Operate a Motor Vehicle with a Valid Drivers License;
No contact with the victims listed in the criminal complaint.  
Provide DNA sample if not yet provided  and pay surcharge
DEFENDANT IS ALLOWED TO USE A COMPUTER FOR WORK AND PERSONAL USE.  

CONDITION TIME:120 days HUBER- NON WORKING HOURS WITH STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS - To commence 6pm on 8/20/2015

Restitution: $167.00 to be paid from Cashbail posted
FINE:  $891.00 to be paid from Cashbail posted, remainder to be paid as a condition of probation   
DNA Surcharge: $250.00 to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 to be paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Village of Pewaukee Police Department.
DL REVOCATION:  18 months.
IGNITITION INTERLOCK:  18 months.
Defendant to attend the Victim Impact Panel during probation.

Defendant Nicholas M Kramer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Mary C. Brejcha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads no contest to count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed on operations of law.  Court finds the defendant guilty.  Attorney Scholz moves for a new sentencing date.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Nicholas M Kramer in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for defendant's motion to suppress.  State calls Officer Lucas Twelmeyer to the stand.  Officer Twelmeyer sworn in and testified on direct examination, cross examination and judicial inquiry.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Court declares testimony and evidence closed.  Arguments by both counsel.  Court denies defendant's motion to suppress.  Defense requests further proceedings date.
